creator: kharvatis@ekke.gr
text:
iso-8859-7 encoding not supported. such encoded data from html forms are lost 
(converted to ?'s). relevant error message is printed by tomcat when the 
enctype parameter is set withing the <form> tag.

creator: kharvatis@ekke.gr
text:
problem does not appear with tomcat 5.
hence it is a tomcat servlet spec implementation issue.

do you use GET or POST method? If you use GET method, see nug 23929 and mark
this invalid. Although is this case tomcat 5 should also be affected
creator: stefos@msc.gr
kharvatis@ekke.gr
text:
I use forms with POST method only, *and* explicit servlet 
request.setCharacterEncoding().

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
Ok, normally I just ignore 3.2.x bugs, but this one is starting to get silly:

a)  The TC 3.2.x branch is no longer supported (which is the reason for the 
WONTFIX :).
b)  You can't possibly be calling setCharacterEncoding, since it didn't exist 
until the Servlet 2.3-spec (and 3.2.x implements the Servlet-2.2-spec).
